result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles Richard Singer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the event that the defendant is discharged from probation with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent SHALL notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment SHALL be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

miscConds.notes: Defendant is to pay court costs, including the DNA surcharge.  Bond money is to be applied.
Defendant is to receive an AODA evaluation and follow through with any treatment.
Defendant is to provide a DNA sample.    Defendant is to comply with any treatment/programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and agent.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent to Count 2. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt: John Sacia for the State; Def appeared in person w/atty Carly Sebion.  Court advised Def of rights.  Def KVI waives rights.  Court finds Def KVI waives rights.  Def enters plea to Counts 2 & 3.  Court finds Def G of Counts 2 & 3.  Count 1 DRI.  Def sentenced.
John Sacia for the State.  Defendent and Attorney Sebion appear in person.  Trial and Jury Status dates set.  Bond cont.

John Sacia for the State.  Def appeared in person with atty Carly Sebion.  Def wishes to waive right to PH.  Court advised Def of right to PH.  Def KVI waives right to PH.  Court finds Def KVI waives right to PH.  Court finds probable cause felony committed and binds over for further proceedings.  Information filed.  Proceeds to arraignment.  Atty Sebion states Def waives reading of information and enters NG pleas.  PTC and STC set.  Bond cont.

Defendant not to possess or consume illegal drugs.  No possession or consumption of drugs that are not prescribed.  Defendant to comply/cooperate with Child Protective Services.
